block.p: SUNTERRA CORP., Orlando, Fla., an operator of 90 time-share resorts in North America, Europe and Asia, said it had filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection from its creditors.
TANDYCRAFTS INC., Fort Worth, the No. 2 maker of picture frames in the United States, has closed its frame plant in Van Nuys, Calif., and will shift those operations to Durango, Mexico, to cut costs.
SUNTERRA CORP., Orlando, Fla., an operator of 90 time-share resorts in North America, Europe and Asia, said it had filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection from its creditors.
TANDYCRAFTS INC., Fort Worth, the No. 2 maker of picture frames in the United States, has closed its frame plant in Van Nuys, Calif., and will shift those operations to Durango, Mexico, to cut costs.

METRO INFORMATION SERVICES INC., Virginia Beach, Va., a software and information technology consulting company, plans to close 8 of its 44 offices and dismiss 25 workers to focus better on its more profitable sites.

ENRON ENERGY SERVICES, Houston, the largest wholesaler of natural gas and power sources in the United States, said it had received a 10-year $1 billion contract from Quebecor World Inc., Canada, a commercial printer, to supply and manage electricity and natural gas at more than 60 Quebecor plants in the United States.
